question_text: A 72-year-old man with COPD is evaluated for acute cough, fever, and dyspnea.Posteroanterior (top) and lateral (bottom) chest radiographs are shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is right upper lobe pneumonia (Option C). The posteroanterior chest radiograph (top) shows an alveolar infiltrate in the right upper lung zone that obliterates the ascending aorta. The lateral chest radiograph (bottom) shows an infiltrate in the superior lung field anterior to the major fissure. These findings are most consistent with a right upper lobe infiltrate (pneumonia).
